titleStmt.title: An elegy, sacred to the memory of our most gracious sovereigne Lord King Charles who was most barbarously murdered by the sectaries of the army January 30. MDCxlix.

notesStmt.note: With engraving of royal seal at head of text.
Roman numeral date in title made with turned Cs.
Verse - "Tumble ye Phætons, since you've your desire,".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
